rice is lent by wealthy men, largely for prestige
(-); as a common system of tenure [underlined]
“Most Aos do a little trading, but no one relies on it for his livelihood”
The village, of 2 or 3 Khel, is the biggest unit

part of the fine was usually eaten by the arbitrators; The rest went to the offended party.
(+); none reported, but grinding is used for making spindle whorls, and hard stone is plentiful. Pre-metal, I think (+) is more likely than (-)
Ao metal-working began 5 generations ago when 4 descendants of immigrants to the territory (c. 1700) became accultured by Aos and taught them the craft.
